function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Non-pharmaceutical interventions vary between countries","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High 𝑅 𝑡 leading to uncontrolled epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of control measures leading to virus spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited testing capacity leading to biased view of infection trends.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on reported deaths for estimating infection rates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Strong assumption of intervention efficacy across different countries.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited testing capacity leading to underestimation of true infections","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Timing of interventions and speed of implementation varying among countries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited data on the impact of interventions and uncertainty in model estimates","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher proportion of the population infected in spain 15.0%","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Uncertainty in countries","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to conclude whether interventions are sufficient to drive rt below impossibility of determining the greatest effect of interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability of the model without interventions to capture recent trends
